DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: Miguel Vazquez;M. Vazquez;Vazquez, M.;M Vazquez;Vazquez, M;VAZQUEZ, MIGUEL;VA'ZQUEZ, M.;VÁZQUEZ, MIGUEL;Vazquez, Miguel;Vázquez, Miguel

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Miguel é professor na Universidade Federal Fluminense, Conselheiro da Florence School of Regulation, e pesquisador associado ao Grupo de Economia da Energia do Instituto de Economia da UFRJ. A atividade de pesquisa do Miguel inclui a estruturação de mercados, a regulação econômica das indústrias de rede, o estudo dos mecanismos de coordenação (cooperação e competição) dos agentes econômicos além da modelização do comportamento dos mesmos. Miguel já participou em numerosos projetos de pesquisa para reguladores, firmas e administrações públicas, tanto na Europa quanto na América do Sul. Desenvolveu modelos qualitativos e quantitativos para estudos tanto de curto prazo quanto de longo prazo.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Miguelis Professor at Uninversidade Federal Fluminense, Advisor at Florence School of Regulation, and research associate at the Grupo de Economia da Energia, Instituto de Economia, UFRJ. Miguel's research interests include market design, economic regulation of network industries and modeling of market behavior. He is a regular speaker in international conferences and has published his work in professional and academic journals. He has participated in a variety of projects for regulators, utilities and public authorities in Europe and South America, and developed quantitative models for both short- and long-term studies of energy markets.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Design and bidding behavior in long- and short-term power auctions
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project was aimed at analyzing the main elements of power auctions both from a bidder and a designer point of view. It dealt with principles and criteria to design auctions to sell electricity in the short and in the long run. Furthermore, it modeled and simulated agents' bidding behavior in medium- and short-term auctions, with emphasis on the construction of bidding curves for wind generation.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Design and bidding behavior in long- and short-term power auctions

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: One of the consequences of the financial crisis in 2008 was a steep increase of public debt in many countries. The need for fiscal retrenchment in coming years will likely put further pressure on governments to find alternative sources of financing for their infrastructure investments. While the need for private infrastructure finance is greater than ever, it will only come forth in sufficient amounts if governments have a solid understanding of the specific incentives, information problems and risks that confront private investors in infrastructure. This project aims at analyzing available tools and identify future needs in order to address the specific needs of infrastructure sectors.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Coevolution of technology and institutions in emergent industries
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: When dealing with network industries institutional design, one is frequently faced with the problem of technological change and evolution (e.g. the role of institutional design in energy transition or governance of smart cities). This practical difficulty has motivated a research project that intends to combine both standpoints to obtain sound recommendations for industry and policy-makers. The dynamic nature of the problem constitutes a significant theoretical challenge, as much of the theory developed within the institutional and organizational economics pays limited attention to technological change. This research line is focused on the interaction between rules and business strategies, and the interaction with other infrastructures.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Coevolution of technology and institutions in emergent industries

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Institutions and contracts in network industries (electricity, gas, transport, tlc, water)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The objective of this project is to understand network industries including energy, water, telecom and transport sectors. This project is made up of two phases: a) the study of gas and power industries, with the aim of identifying general theoretical elements that can be extended to the rest of network industries; b) the study of other network industries, identifying common points with energy industries, as well as points of departure. We will study the ongoing liberalization process, internationalization, re-regulation, as well as the multiplication of pressures on the provision of public service and the preservation of the infrastructures? quality. The backbone of the project will be the analysis of the market design of network industries. To that end, we will use a level combination of the study of industry specificities and a comprehensive overview of the market design in network industries. We will have a cross-sector and international perspective, and we will pay special attention to the key theoretical elements necessary to understand the complex process of designing these markets. Networks industries are characterized by the fact that practical issues drive theory. Typically, network industries questions are poorly addressed by standard economic theory. In order to build our approach, the project will build on three pillars: (i) Theoretical elements?develop a framework to work and study a broad set of problems, by means of developing the abstract toolkit that will be then applied to study particular problems; (ii) Paradigmatic problems?we will tackle the most characteristic issues in each of the five industries; (iii) Case studies?in order to ensure the knowledge transfer, we will use a broad set of case studies, where the theoretical framework will be applied to solve real regulatory challenges.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Institutions and contracts in network industries (electricity, gas, transport, tlc, water)
